result.execSummary:
The defendant Romulin J Huizar-Barforth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain high school diploma, obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with any gang member. No social media referencing this incident, the victims, or gang affiliation/identity with a gun. Defendant must live with mother - cannot change residence without approval of Agent. Curfew 6pm - may be modified by mother and agent. Defendant may not associate with anyone mother does not approve of, including M.G. Anger Management, Life Skills program, counseling as required.   Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Defendant must serve 270 days with credit for time served. Huber granted for school. Balance of time is stayed.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including relapse prevention programming.
Restitution of $250.00 ordered at sentencing remains due and owing.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Provide DNA sample and pay assessed surcharge if not previously complied with.  No contact with co-actors.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Report to Racine Vocational Ministry for re-entry program.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on January 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Romulin J Huizar-Barforth in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Romulin J Huizar-Barforth in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Atty Fritz informs the court that the last name is spelled wrong. The correct spelling is Huizar-Barfoth, clerk to change name per Comm Rudebusch.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness. VI-DT $250.00

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim or co-actor(s).  No firearms.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing on December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romulin J Huizar-Barforth in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Romulin J Huizar-Barforth in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond previously set, conditions to remain the same as well.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
